channel.title: Creating a Posting System?
channel.description:
Well, I know exceptionally little about web design. But I could probably read code easily, just not make it at this point in time. So, to the point. I'm using Dreamweaver (Or trying, anyways) to create a few input boxes such as a title box and a main content box. The things is I don't know my way around dreamweaver for shit, nor do I know how to produce the code to write this stuff to a file.
So, if anyone can hint me, provide a tutorial or even be sexy enough to post some actual code I could build off of, I'd love you.

item.title: Creating a Posting System?
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:28, topic:26274”][quote author=Bang Train link=topic=39283.msg490764#msg490764 date=1164009691]
you dont have to do it line by line

str_replace can do an entire string all at once.replacing all occurrences of the search
[/quote]I have to replace certain things with other things though.

Username, put the interpreter code into an html document and it’ll post it there.

Of course, you’ll have to mod it a little bit for your site ;)[/quote]
Thanks Pwnd <3

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a Posting System?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

eet wekrs so fhk awf.

=)[br][size=1]Posted at: November 19, 2006, 04:43:39 PM[/size][hr]So, I’ma post teh shits for you guys if you want to use them =)
The form:

[code]

Update News

Update News

Name:
Email:
Signature:
Message:

[/code] The writer (write.php): [code]<?php echo "

Updating posts...

"; $filename = "results.txt"; $old = ""; 
if (is_file($filename)) {
	$handle= fopen($filename, 'rb');

	while (($line = fgets($handle)) !== false) {
	$old .= $line;
	}
	fclose($handle);
	if (unlink($filename)) {
		echo "Unlinked!<br>";
	}
}

$handle = fopen($filename, 'a');	

$sig = "";
if ($_POST['sig'] === "on") {
	$sig = "<p>Thank you, <br>" . $_POST['name'];
}		
$string = "#" . date("F d, Y") . " - By " . $_POST['name'] . ":<br>*" . $_POST['message'] . $sig . "^

" . $old;

fputs($handle, $string);
fclose($handle);
echo "<br /><h4>Finished!</h4>";

?>
[/code]
The interpreter:

<?php $local = "results.txt"; if(is_file($local)) { $file = fopen($local, "rb") or ext("Couldn't open the file!");; while (($line = fgets($file)) !== false) { $line = str_replace("#", "<span class="style1">", $line); $line = str_replace("*", "</span>", $line); $line = str_replace("^", "<br>", $line); $line = str_replace("'", "'", $line); echo $line . "<p>"; } fclose($file); } else { echo "No news available"; } ?>
Thanks again everyone =)

It in action: www.pwnds.info

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a Posting System?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Trying to load the contents into the page.

It loads for me Maybe it has a hard time since it’s constantly trying to load the same thing. It just repeats:
Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id #2Resource id

;O[br][size=1]Posted at: November 19, 2006, 03:01:22 PM[/size][hr][php]while (($line = fgets($file)) !== false) {
$line = str_replace("#", “”, $line);
$line = str_replace(">*", “>
”, $line);
echo $line;
}[/php]
Latest.[br][size=1]Posted at: November 19, 2006, 04:01:54 PM[/size][hr]I got it <3

Thanks for everyone’s help.

item.title: Creating a Posting System?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

K, now I’m trying to echo the file back to the website.

[php]<?php
$file = fopen(“results.txt”, “r”) or ext(“Couldn’t open the file!”);;
while(!feof($file)) {
if (strstr($file, “#”)) {
echo “<span class=“style1”>” . $file . “
”;
continue;
} else {
echo fgets($file) . “
”;
}
}
fclose($file);
?>[/php]

I was using that.

[php]<?php
$file = fopen(“results.txt”, “r”) or ext(“Couldn’t open the file!”);;
while(!feof($file)) {
str_replace("#", “span class=“style1”>”, $file);
str_replace("`", “
”, $file);
print $file;
}
fclose($file);
?>[/php]

Is the new one. The provide the same output. ;|
www.pwnds.info/index2.php is what it looks like ;O

I don’t know what the .startsWith() equiv for php is, but someone suggested strstr.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a Posting System?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

it is case sensitive, just name things as you would in java but with a $ in front

$writetext = $_POST[‘areaname’];
OR if you use get
$writetext = $_GET[‘areaname’];
